001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.io.FileDescriptor;
004import java.io.Flushable;
005import java.io.IOException;
006import java.io.OutputStream;
007import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
008import java.net.URI;
009import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
010import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
011import java.util.Objects;
012
013import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogAppender.AppenderFlag;
014import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder.Buffer;
015import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder.BufferHints;
016import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.CaseChanging;
017
018/**
019 * A resource that can be written to usually in binary. In other logging frameworks this
020 * is often called an "Appender" not be confused with RainbowGum's appenders. LogOutputs
021 * will be written synchronously by the appender either through locks or some other
022 * mechanism so other than output external specific locking (e.g file locking or db
023 * transaction) the output does not have to deal with that. <strong> In other words there
024 * will be no overlapping write/flush/close calls as the appender and publisher combo
025 * promises that. </strong>
026 * <p>
027 * To simplyfy flushing and corruption prevention each call to the write methods MUST be
028 * the contents of the entire event! However the output should not flush unless
029 * {@link #flush()} is called by the appender. That is the appender
030 * <strong>usually</strong> decides when to flush.
031 * <p>
032 * The write methods do not throw {@link IOException} on purpose as it is implementations
033 * responsibility to handle errors and to be resilient on their own.
034 *
035 * @see LogOutput.OutputProvider
036 * @see Buffer
037 * @see AppenderFlag#IMMEDIATE_FLUSH
038 * @apiNote if for some reason the output needs to share events with other threads call
039 * {@link LogEvent#freeze()} which will return an immutable event.
040 */
041public interface LogOutput extends LogLifecycle, Flushable, LogComponent {
042
043        /**
044         * {@link FileDescriptor#err} URI scheme.
045         */
046        static final String STDERR_SCHEME = "stderr";
047
048        /**
049         * {@link FileDescriptor#out} URI scheme.
050         */
051        static final String STDOUT_SCHEME = "stdout";
052
053        /**
054         * File URI scheme.
055         */
056        static final String FILE_SCHEME = "file";
057
058        /**
059         * Standard OUT URI.
060         */
061        static final URI STDOUT_URI = URI.create(STDOUT_SCHEME + ":///");
062
063        /**
064         * Standard ERR URI
065         */
066        static final URI STDERR_URI = URI.create(STDERR_SCHEME + ":///");
067
068        /**
069         * Provides a lazy loaded output from a URI.
070         * @param uri uri.
071         * @return provider of output.
072         * @apiNote the provider may throw an {@link UncheckedIOException}.
073         */
074        private static LogProvider<LogOutput> of(URI uri) {
075                /*
076                 * TODO this should probably be public.
077                 */
078                return of(LogProviderRef.of(uri));
079        }
080
081        /**
082         * Provides a lazy loaded output from a URI.
083         * @param ref uri.
084         * @return provider of output.
085         * @apiNote the provider may throw an {@link UncheckedIOException}.
086         */
087        public static LogProvider<LogOutput> of(LogProviderRef ref) {
088                return (s, c) -> {
089                        return c.outputRegistry().provide(ref).provide(s, c);
090                };
091        }
092
093        /**
094         * Standard out output. The default implementation <em>uses whatever is set to
095         * {@link System#out} at provision time</em>. <strong>If {@link System#out} is rebound
096         * the output will not be updated!</strong>
097         * @return output.
098         */
099        public static LogProvider<LogOutput> ofStandardOut() {
100                return of(LogOutput.STDOUT_URI);
101        }
102
103        /**
104         * Standard err output. The default implementation <em>uses whatever is set to
105         * {@link System#err} at provision time</em>. <strong>If {@link System#err} is rebound
106         * the output will not be updated!</strong>
107         * @return output.
108         */
109        public static LogProvider<LogOutput> ofStandardErr() {
110                return of(LogOutput.STDERR_URI);
111        }
112
113        /**
114         * Finds output based on URI.
115         */
116        public interface OutputProvider {
117
118                /**
119                 * Creates an output ready to be injected with config.
120                 * @param ref a URI reference to the output.
121                 * @return provider of output.
122                 */
123                LogProvider<LogOutput> provide(LogProviderRef ref);
124
125        }
126
127        /**
128         * The content type of the binary data passed to the output from an encoder.
129         */
130        public interface ContentType {
131
132                /**
133                 * Content type of binary datay passed to output.
134                 * @return content type.
135                 */
136                String contentType();
137
138                /**
139                 * Builtin content types.
140                 *
141                 * @apiNote additional "standard" content types maybe added in the future before
142                 * 1.0 thus one should expect the number of enum symbols to change and is not safe
143                 * to pattern match on without a default.
144                 */
145                @CaseChanging
146                public enum StandardContentType implements ContentType {
147
148                        /**
149                         * text/plain
150                         */
151                        TEXT_PLAIN() {
152                                @Override
153                                public String contentType() {
154                                        return "text/plain";
155                                }
156                        },
157                        /**
158                         * application/json
159                         */
160                        APPLICATION_JSON() {
161                                @Override
162                                public String contentType() {
163                                        return "application/json";
164                                }
165                        }
166
167                }
168
169        }
170
171        /**
172         * The uri of the output.
173         * @return uri.
174         * @throws UnsupportedOperationException if this output does not support URI
175         * representation.
176         *
177         */
178        public URI uri() throws UnsupportedOperationException;
179
180        /**
181         * Requests the health of this output. If no exception is thrown the returned value is
182         * used. If an exception is thrown the status is considered to be error. This call
183         * follows the write rules where there will never be overlapping calls. The default
184         * implementation will return {@link LogResponse.Status.StandardStatus#OK}. which will
185         * check previous meta log error entries.
186         * @return status of this output.
187         * @throws Exception if status check fails which will be an error status.
188         */
189        default LogResponse.Status status() throws Exception {
190                return LogResponse.Status.StandardStatus.OK;
191        }
192
193        @Override
194        default void start(LogConfig config) {
195        }
196
197        /**
198         * Write a batch of events by default calls
199         * {@link #write(LogEvent[], int, LogEncoder, Buffer)}. <strong>DO NOT MODIFY THE
200         * ARRAY</strong>. Do not use the <code>length</code> of the passed in array but
201         * instead use <code>count</code> parameter.
202         * @param events an array guaranteed to be smaller than count.
203         * @param count the number of items.
204         * @param encoder encoder to use for encoding.
205         */
206        default void write(LogEvent[] events, int count, LogEncoder encoder) {
207                try (var buffer = encoder.buffer(this.bufferHints())) {
208                        write(events, count, encoder, buffer);
209                }
210        }
211
212        /**
213         * Write a batch of events reusing the provided buffer and by default calling
214         * {@link #write(LogEvent, Buffer)} for each event synchronously.
215         * <p>
216         * The batching is usually a result of an asynchronous publisher so the maximum size
217         * is configured there with bufferSize. If this method is implemented there are some
218         * caveats.
219         * <p>
220         * <strong>DO NOT MODIFY THE ARRAY</strong>. It is reused. Do not use the
221         * <code>length</code> of the passed in array but instead use <code>count</code>
222         * parameter. Consequently do not share the array or buffer with other threads however
223         * individual events can be shared by calling {@link LogEvent#freeze()} to guarantee
224         * that which is a safe no-op if it is already immutable.
225         * <p>
226         * If the output plans on grouping the events into a single blob (byte array or byte
227         * buffer) a different output can be passed to the encoder other than itself (which is
228         * the default).
229         * @param events an array guaranteed to be smaller than count.
230         * @param count the number of items.
231         * @param encoder encoder to use for encoding.
232         * @param buffer buffer to reuse. Do not share it with other threads!
233         * @apiNote If the output wants to fan-out or encode with other threads the buffer
234         * passed should not be used and instead {@link LogEncoder#buffer(BufferHints)} should
235         * be called to get a new buffer for each thread. This is generally not desirable for
236         * most resources such as a file or database as sending a batch is much faster (single
237         * writer principle).
238         */
239        default void write(LogEvent[] events, int count, LogEncoder encoder, Buffer buffer) {
240                for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
241                        buffer.clear();
242                        var event = events[i];
243                        encoder.encode(event, buffer);
244                        write(event, buffer);
245                }
246        }
247
248        /**
249         * Writes a prepared buffer and by default drains the buffer to this output.
250         * @param event event.
251         * @param buffer buffer that is already filled. Do not share it with other threads!
252         * @apiNote the buffer already has the encoding.
253         */
254        default void write(LogEvent event, Buffer buffer) {
255                buffer.drain(this, event);
256        }
257
258        /**
259         * Writes a string and by default with charset {@link StandardCharsets#UTF_8}.
260         * @param event event associated with string.
261         * @param s string.
262         */
263        default void write(LogEvent event, String s) {
264                write(event, s.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8), ContentType.StandardContentType.TEXT_PLAIN);
265        }
266
267        /**
268         * Analogous to {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])}.
269         * @param event event associated with bytes.
270         * @param bytes data to be written.
271         * @param contentType content type of the bytes.
272         */
273        default void write(LogEvent event, byte[] bytes, ContentType contentType) {
274                write(event, bytes, 0, bytes.length, contentType);
275        }
276
277        /**
278         * Analogous to {@link OutputStream#write(byte[], int, int)}.
279         * @param event event associated with bytes.
280         * @param bytes data to be written.
281         * @param off offset.
282         * @param len length.
283         * @param contentType content type of the bytes.
284         */
285        public void write(LogEvent event, byte[] bytes, int off, int len, ContentType contentType);
286
287        /**
288         * Write event with byte buffer.
289         * @param event event.
290         * @param buf byte buffer.
291         * @param contentType content type of the buf
292         */
293        default void write(LogEvent event, ByteBuffer buf, ContentType contentType) {
294                byte[] arr = new byte[buf.position()];
295                buf.rewind();
296                buf.get(arr);
297                write(event, arr, contentType);
298        }
299
300        /**
301         * Flushes if the output is maintaining a buffer. An appender will call this after
302         * each event in synchronous mode or after a batched group of events if in
303         * asynchronous mode if {@link LogAppender.AppenderFlag#IMMEDIATE_FLUSH} is set.
304         * @see LogAppender.AppenderFlag#IMMEDIATE_FLUSH
305         */
306        @Override
307        public void flush();
308
309        /**
310         * Gross categorization of an output.
311         * @return output type.
312         */
313        public OutputType type();
314
315        /**
316         * Hints to the buffer like what write style of the output and maximum buffer size.
317         * The output should still honor all write methods but this signals to the encoder
318         * which style it prefers.
319         * @return write mode.
320         */
321        default BufferHints bufferHints() {
322                return WriteMethod.BYTES;
323        }
324
325        /**
326         * Attempts to reopen the output if supported and <strong>SHOULD only be called by the
327         * appender</strong>! This call is mainly used for external log rotation systems such
328         * as logrotate or an aggregator agent.
329         * @return status and the default implementation will return
330         * {@link LogResponse.Status.StandardStatus#IGNORED}.
331         */
332        default LogResponse.Status reopen() {
333                return LogResponse.Status.StandardStatus.IGNORED;
334        }
335
336        /**
337         * The preferred write style of an output. The output should still honor all write
338         * methods but this signals to the encoder which style it prefers.
339         */
340        public enum WriteMethod implements BufferHints {
341
342                /**
343                 * Prefer calling {@link LogOutput#write(LogEvent, String)}.
344                 */
345                STRING,
346                /**
347                 * Prefer calling {@link LogOutput#write(LogEvent, byte[], ContentType)} or
348                 * {@link LogOutput#write(LogEvent, byte[], int, int, ContentType)}.
349                 */
350                BYTES,
351                /**
352                 * Prefer calling {@link LogOutput#write(LogEvent, ByteBuffer, ContentType)}.
353                 */
354                BYTE_BUFFER;
355
356                @Override
357                public WriteMethod writeMethod() {
358                        return this;
359                }
360
361        }
362
363        /**
364         * Output type useful for defaults and categorization.
365         */
366        @CaseChanging
367        public enum OutputType {
368
369                /**
370                 * Standard out.
371                 */
372                CONSOLE_OUT,
373                /**
374                 * Standard err.
375                 */
376                CONSOLE_ERR,
377                /**
378                 * Output targets a file.
379                 */
380                FILE,
381                /**
382                 * Output targets something over a network.
383                 */
384                NETWORK,
385                /**
386                 * Output targets in memory.
387                 */
388                MEMORY;
389
390        }
391
392        /**
393         * Will close the output and should only be called by the owning appender.
394         */
395        @Override
396        void close();
397
398        /**
399         * Marker interface that the output is thread safe.
400         */
401        public interface ThreadSafeLogOutput extends LogOutput {
402
403        }
404
405        /**
406         * Abstract output on output stream.
407         */
408        abstract class AbstractOutputStreamOutput implements LogOutput {
409
410                /**
411                 * passed in uri
412                 */
413                protected final URI uri;
414
415                /**
416                 * output stream to write to.
417                 */
418                protected final OutputStream outputStream;
419
420                /**
421                 * Adapts an OutputStream to an Output.
422                 * @param uri usually comes from output registry.
423                 * @param outputStream output stream to adapt.
424                 */
425                protected AbstractOutputStreamOutput(URI uri, OutputStream outputStream) {
426                        super();
427                        this.uri = uri;
428                        this.outputStream = outputStream;
429                }
430
431                @Override
432                public URI uri() {
433                        return uri;
434                }
435
436                @Override
437                public void write(LogEvent event, byte[] bytes, int off, int len, ContentType contentType) {
438                        try {
439                                outputStream.write(bytes, off, len);
440                        }
441                        catch (IOException e) {
442                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
443                        }
444                }
445
446                @Override
447                public void flush() {
448                        try {
449                                outputStream.flush();
450                        }
451                        catch (IOException e) {
452                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
453                        }
454                }
455
456                @Override
457                public void close() {
458                        try {
459                                outputStream.close();
460                        }
461                        catch (IOException e) {
462                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
463                        }
464                }
465
466                @Override
467                public BufferHints bufferHints() {
468                        return WriteMethod.BYTES;
469                }
470
471        }
472
473}
474
475class StdOutOutput extends LogOutput.AbstractOutputStreamOutput {
476
477        public StdOutOutput() {
478                super(LogOutput.STDOUT_URI, Objects.requireNonNull(System.out));
479        }
480
481        @Override
482        public LogOutput.OutputType type() {
483                return OutputType.CONSOLE_OUT;
484        }
485
486        @Override
487        public void close() {
488        }
489
490}
491
492class StdErrOutput extends LogOutput.AbstractOutputStreamOutput {
493
494        protected StdErrOutput() {
495                super(LogOutput.STDERR_URI, Objects.requireNonNull(System.err));
496        }
497
498        @Override
499        public OutputType type() {
500                return OutputType.CONSOLE_ERR;
501        }
502
503}
